content.text:
# List of NBA G League awards

The NBA G League, formerly known as the National Basketball Development League (NBDL) and NBA Development League (D-League), presents 11 annual awards to recognize its teams, players, and coaches for their accomplishments. This does not include the G League championship trophy, which is given to the winning team of the G League Finals.
Team trophies
Current
{| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" summary="Image, Award (sortable), Created (sortable), Description, Most recent winner and Notes"
! scope="col" | Award
! scope="col" | First awarded
! scope="col" class="unsortable" | Description
! scope="col" class="unsortable" | Most recent winner
|-
! scope="row" style="background-color:transparent;" | Championship Trophy
| align="center" |2002
|The league's championship trophy; awarded to the winning team of the playoff finals.
|Oklahoma City Blue (2024)
|}
Former
{| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" summary="Image, Award (sortable), Created (sortable), Description, Most recent winner and Notes"
! scope="col" | Award
! scope="col" | First awarded
! Last awarded
! scope="col" class="unsortable" | Description
|-
! scope="row" style="background-color:transparent;" |Development Champion
| align="center" |2012
| align="center" |2015
|Awarded to the team that best embodies the league's goals of developing NBA basketball talent via call-ups and assignments.
|}
Honors
{| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" summary="Honor (sortable), Created (sortable), Description and Notes"
!scope="col" width=15% class="unsortable"| Honor
!scope="col"| Created
!scope="col" class="unsortable"| Description
|-
!scope="row" style="background-color:transparent;"| All-NBA G League Team
|align=center| 2002||Three 5-player teams (a first, second, and third team) composed of the best players in the league during the regular season.
|-
!scope="row" style="background-color:transparent;"| All-Defensive Team
|align=center| 2011||5-player team composed of the best defensive players in the league during the regular season.
|-
!scope="row" style="background-color:transparent;"| All-Rookie Team
|align=center| 2011||5-player team composed of the top rookies during the regular season.
|}
Individual awards
Current
{| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" summary="Award (sortable), Created (sortable), Description and Most recent winner(s)"
! scope="col" width="22%" | Award
! scope="col" width="1%" | First awarded
! scope="col" width="50%" class="unsortable" | Description
! scope="col" width="25%" class="unsortable" | Most recent winner(s)
|-
! scope="row" style="background-color:transparent;" |Most Valuable Player
| align="center" |2002
|Awarded to the best performing player of the regular season.
|Mac McClung, Osceola Magic (2023–24)
|-
! scope="row" style="background-color:transparent;" |Finals MVP
| align="center" |2015
|Awarded to the best performing player of the league finals.
|Ousmane Dieng, Oklahoma City Blue (2023-24)
|-
! scope="row" style="background-color:transparent;" |Defensive Player of the Year
| align="center" |2002
|Awarded to the best defensive player of the regular season.
|Shaquille Harrison, South Bay Lakers (2023–24)
|-
! scope="row" style="background-color:transparent;" |Most Improved Player
| align="center" |2010
|Awarded to the most improved player across the regular season.
|Alondes Williams, Sioux Falls Skyforce (2023–24)
|-
! scope="row" style="background-color:transparent;" |Rookie of the Year
| align="center" |2002
|Awarded to the top rookie of the regular season.
|Oscar Tshiebwe, Indiana Mad Ants (2023–24)
|-
! scope="row" style="background-color:transparent;" |Coach of the Year (Dennis Johnson Trophy)
| align="center" |2007
|Awarded to the best coach of the regular season.
|Lindsey Harding, Stockton Kings (2023–24)
|-
! scope="row" style="background-color:transparent;" |Sportsmanship Award
| align="center" |2002
|Awarded to the player who best represents the ideals of character and conduct on and off the court.
|Gabe Osabuohien, Cleveland Charge (2023–24)
|-
! scope="row" style="background-color:transparent;" |Basketball Executive of the Year
| align="center" |2016
|Awarded to the league's top front office executive involved with basketball operations.
|Eric Amsler, Sioux Falls Skyforce (2023-24)
|-
! scope="row" style="background-color:transparent;" |Team Executive of the Year
| align="center" |2010
|Awarded to the league's top front office executive involved with team operations.
|
|}

! scope="col" width="22%" | Award

! Last awarded
! scope="col" width="75%" class="unsortable" | Description
|-
! scope="row" style="background-color:transparent;" |All-Star Game MVP
| align="center" |2007
| align="center" |2017
|Awarded to the best performing player of the All-Star Game.
|-
! scope="row" style="background-color:transparent;" |Impact Player of the Year
| align="center" |2008
| align="center" |2017
|Awarded to the player who joined the league mid-season and made the greatest contribution to his team's success following that acquisition.
|}
